nodes.name: Becoming Engine
nodes.description: The regulatory system itself, eating its own dogfood

variables.name: Code Health
variables.description: Is the codebase in good shape?
variables.preferredRange: Test coverage >80%, zero lint errors, zero type errors, all tests passing

variables.name: UX Coherence
variables.description: Is the UI consistent and usable?
variables.preferredRange: UI follows design system, no visual regressions, intuitive navigation

variables.name: Doctrine Alignment
variables.description: Does the system match the philosophy?
variables.preferredRange: ADR compliance, no anti-patterns, constraints enforced, baseline quiet

variables.name: Adoption
variables.preferredRange: Active users, regular sessions, growing usage over time

models.statement: Never ship features that create capture loops or coercive patterns
The default state is quiet. Features should reduce noise, not add it.
All pull requests require review before merge
Run npm run check before committing. If it fails, fix before moving on.
Functions over 20 lines tend to accumulate bugs. Split them.
Explicit return types catch errors earlier than inferred types.
